comments:
On startup, for some unknown, non-understandable reason I get the following
error message - 

Problems occurred refreshing workspace.
Reason:
Errors occurred while refreshing resources with the local file system.

Under Details it says -
JPriseMerge.jar is an invalid resource name.


This error message is not very helpful IMHO! Does not tell me why, what is
wrong, or what to do about it. I can find nothing in the documentation either on
this error. 

Why is this an invalid resource name? What constitutes a valid resource name?
Where are resources defined? What do you suggest I do about this resource name?

A GOOD error message not only tells the user what is wrong, but suggests how to
fix it, or what document to read to understand why the error occurred. A GOOD
user interface always GUIDES a user to a solution, not leave him hanging like
this does.

JPriseMerge.jar is not part of the standard Eclipse.  What non-Eclipse plugins 
do you have installed?  Is there anything in your .log file?

Sorry, I guess I should have mentioned JPriseMerge.jar is one of our own project
jar files. It is not a part of any plugin.

I had no additional plugins installed when I got this error. Was using a fresh
install of Eclipse.

After hunting around quite a bit, I finally found the .log file that you were
refering to. (Perhaps this could be made a little more obvious?)  Within it, I
found the following walkback just prior to mention of the error about
JPriseMerge.jar -

!ENTRY org.eclipse.jdt.ui 4 10001 Jul 01, 2004 22:46:04.100
!MESSAGE Internal Error
!STACK 1
Java Model Exception: Core Exception [code 271] Errors occurred while refreshing
resources with the local file system.
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.BatchOperation.executeOperation(BatchOperation.java:45)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.run(JavaModelOperation.java:700)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1673)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.run(JavaCore.java:3246)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.actions.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.run(WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.java:65)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:101)
Caused by: org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.ResourceException: Errors
occurred while refreshing resources with the local file system.
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refreshResource(FileSystemResourceManager.java:625)
	at
org.eclipse.core.internal.localstore.FileSystemResourceManager.refresh(FileSystemResourceManager.java:609)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Resource.refreshLocal(Resource.java:1222)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.ui.actions.RefreshAction$1.run(RefreshAction.java:123)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.BatchOperation.executeOperation(BatchOperation.java:34)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.JavaModelOperation.run(JavaModelOperation.java:700)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1673)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.run(JavaCore.java:3246)
	at
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.ui.actions.WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.run(WorkbenchRunnableAdapter.java:65)
	at
org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:101)
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 271 Jul 01, 2004 22:46:04.102
!MESSAGE Errors occurred while refreshing resources with the local file system.
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 278 Jul 01, 2004 22:46:04.102
!MESSAGE JPriseMerge.jar  is an invalid resource name.
!SESSION Jul 02, 2004 10:00:37.210 ---------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=I200406251208
java.version=1.4.2
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86, WS=gtk, NL=en_US

In this case the UI just displays the message, moving to Core to see if they
would like to try and improve on the error or provide more information in this
exception is thrown.

The filename seems to have a trailing space character: "JPriseMerge.jar ".
Eclipse can't handle trailing spaces in filenames. I agree the error message
doesn't explain this.

This was failing because the file name had trailing whitespace, which Eclipse
previously did not handle.  In Eclipse 3.1 it allows creation of file names with
leading or trailing whitespace, so this is no longer an issue.

traces.message: Errors occurred while refreshing resources with the local file system.
